thread.title: Kellyanne Conway: Leaks are 'dangerous stuff'
thread.title_full: Kellyanne Conway: Leaks are 'dangerous stuff' | Washington Examiner

author: Daniel Chaitin
title: Kellyanne Conway: Leaks are 'dangerous stuff'
text:
Leakers sharing intelligence information with the media is "dangerous stuff" said Trump counselor, Kellyanne Conway, after the president's national security adviser, Mike Flynn, resigned late Monday.
Flynn resigned amid the fallout from revelations that he misled the administration about his communications with a Russian envoy regarding sanctions, before the inauguration of President Trump .
These leaks about intelligence and security "should concern everyone," Conway said in a pre-released transcript of an interview with Fox News' Sean Hannity set to air at 10 p.m. ET.
"If people are running to the media to leak and not providing that information to the proper authorities, that should concern all of us," Conway continued. "This is not a partisan issue. It's dangerous stuff."
  Conway's rebuke of the leakers echoes that of other members of the Trump administration, including Trump himself.
News outlets like the Washington Post and the New York Times had relied on unnamed government sources in their coverage of the Flynn fiasco, which Trump seemed to condemn Tuesday in a tweet that said: "The real story here is why are there so many illegal leaks coming out of Washington? Will these leaks be happening as I deal on N.Korea etc?"
White House press secretary Sean Spicer told reporters Tuesday that the president will launch an investigation into the leaks.
"The president clearly is upset about this, and understands the threat they pose to our national security," Spicer said.
